-- | Utilities for using YUI3 with Happstack.
--   
--   Bundles YUI 3.5.1 and includes a "combo handler" for use in Happstack
--   which concatenates YUI modules server-side to send in a single HTTP
--   request. The YUI bundle can be embedded in compiled code with Template
--   Haskell (install with <tt>-fembed</tt>) which means the files are
--   served directly from memory, and also that you can compile and deploy
--   a single executable without having to worry about deploying the YUI
--   files as well.
--   
--   The benefits of using this over the Yahoo! CDN is that you can work
--   offline and that you can host YUI yourself without sacrificing the
--   benefits of "combo loading".
--   
--   The versioning scheme of this package is that the first part is the
--   targeted Happstack series plus the bundled YUI version, such that 7351
--   means "Happstack 7, YUI 3.5.1". The second part is the major version
--   of this package itself, as defined by the Package Versioning Policy.
--   
--   The package also includes some utilities for working with the YUI CSS
--   modules. In a future release, the plan is to add more utilities, for
--   example a combo handler for YUI modules written using JMacro, a bridge
--   between HSX and YUI Node objects and tools for making it easier to
--   work with modules like Uploader and Pjax.
--   
--   For an example application, see:
--   <a>https://github.com/dag/happstack-yui/blob/master/demo/happstack-yui-demo.hs</a>
@package happstack-yui
@version 7351.3.0

module Happstack.Server.YUI

-- | Mounts a handler for serving YUI.
--   
--   The handler responds to these routes:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><i><tt>/3.5.1/</tt></i> The YUI seed file plus the configuration
--   for using our own combo loader.</li>
--   <li><i><tt>/3.5.1/combo</tt></i> The combo loader.</li>
--   <li><i><tt>/3.5.1/css</tt></i> A specialized combo loader for CSS
--   modules, for use in <tt>&lt;link/&gt;</tt> tags. Simply list the CSS
--   modules in the query string by name rather than file path, for example
--   <tt>"/3.5.1/css?reset&amp;base&amp;fonts&amp;grids"</tt>. Order
--   matters; you'll usually want reset first if you use it.</li>
--   <li><i><tt>/3.5.1/bundle/&lt;filename&gt;</tt></i> Get an individual
--   file without combo loading.</li>
--   <li><i><tt>/3.5.1/config</tt></i> The code for configuring YUI to use
--   our own combo loader. Not needed if you use the seed file mentioned
--   above.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   The version number of the bundled YUI release is included in the
--   routes for sake of cache-busting: the routes all respond with
--   far-future expiration dates.
implYUISite :: Text -> Text -> ServerPartT IO Response

-- | Gets the class name for the grid unit of the ratio of the two argument
--   integers. YUI doesn't define redundant classes like "6/24" because
--   that is the same as 1/4 and presumably for sake of a smaller CSS file.
--   This helper function handles that for you, though:
--   
--   <pre>
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; gridUnit 6 24
--   "yui3-u-1-4"
--   </pre>
--   
--   The intention is for this function to be used in templates to create
--   values for class attributes, for example with HSP:
--   
--   <pre>
--   &lt;div class=(gridUnit 6 24)&gt;
--     &lt;% someContent %&gt;
--   &lt;/div&gt;
--   </pre>
gridUnit :: Integer -> Integer -> Text

-- | Converts a pixel size to a percentage suitable for use with the CSS
--   fonts module:
--   
--   <pre>
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; fontSize 16
--   "123.1%"
--   </pre>
--   
--   Useful in generated stylesheets, for example with HSP:
--   
--   <pre>
--   &lt;style&gt;
--     h1 { font-size: &lt;% fontSize 26 %&gt; }
--   &lt;/style&gt;
--   </pre>
fontSize :: Integer -> Text

-- | Tells if a file is included in the YUI bundle.
--   
--   <pre>
--   &gt;&gt;&gt; isYUIFile "yui/yui-min.js"
--   True
--   </pre>
isYUIFile :: FilePath -> IO Bool

-- | Reads the contents of a file included in the YUI bundle.
readYUIFile :: FilePath -> IO ByteString
